ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Errors while restarting crawls from checkpoints
ygData.msgSnippet: Checkpoints are supposed to work even without a formal pause . The problem *might* be unrelated to these warnings. Does the no progress state happen 100% of

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Errors while restarting crawls from checkpoints
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=sqRmhMIo9UNE0bhDsGR7wk2pYvn1qEbPJPbZQ0YsBobe
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo
From: Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...>

Checkpoints are supposed to work even without a formal 'pause'.

The problem *might* be unrelated to these warnings. Does the "no 
progress" state happen 100% of the time when such warnings are seen, and 
0% of the time after other resumes where no warnings are seen?

In the event that the resumption runs for a while, but then enters the 
no-progress state later, are there any other errors around the time 
progress stops? Do other indicators (queues with ready URIs) suggest 
progress should be faster?

What operating system, JVM, and filesystem? Is the crawler 'state' 
directory on a local volume?

I haven't looked at that code in a while, but at first glance it seems 
odd to me that the same serial-numbered JDB file (00000623) appears 
twice in the output.

IIRC, the very last JDB file of the crawler at the moment of 
checkpointing is handled specially: its current size is remembered in 
the checkpoint, so that even as the normal (original) run continues to 
grow it, if the checkpoint is ever resumed, it can be truncated to the 
right size to represent the state at the moment-of-checkpointing.

So it isn't completely unexpected for a file of name 
"00000623.jdb,9244478" to be temporarily longer than the expected 
9244478 bytes: that's the reason for the ",9244478" suffix. It is odd 
for a warning to be generated during resumption, and the same 
serial-number to be mentioned twice.

Perhaps something in your OS/filesystem is preventing the file from 
being truncated back to its desired size? Looking in other on-disk logs 
(such as heritrix_out.log or the job alerts), there *might* be full 
error-stacks for the WARNINGs somewhere, pointing at the exact lines of 
code whose expectations are first failing.

- Gordon


On 8/17/14, 1:49 AM, 'Markus.Mirsberger' markus.mirsberger@... 
[archive-crawler] wrote:
>
>
> Hi,
>
> as a kind of backup we automatically checkpoint long time crawls regularly.
> When I have to restart a crawl from the checkpoints I sometimes notice the following warnings.
> These are "only" warninngs but nevertheless the crawl doesnt run correct anymore.
> It stops crawling after some time or doesnt even start ... this means crawlspeed is at 0.00 for days (forever).
> In this case I have to restart the crawl with an older, working checkpoint and everything is ok.
>
> Do you have any idea what might cause this error? I guess there is no build in way to automatically verify generated checkpoints isn't it?
> The script which triggers the checkpoints doesn't pause/unpause the job for checkpointing. Could this be the matter?
>
>
> 2014-08-07T16:50:59.514Z INFO RUNNING 20140807165055
> 2014-08-07T16:50:58.706Z INFO PREPARING 20140807165055
> 2014-08-07T16:50:57.407Z WARNING 00000623.jdb expected 9244478 actual 9354448 (in thread 'Crawl_1017 launchthread')
> 2014-08-07T16:50:56.376Z WARNING 00000623.jdb,9244478 expected 9244478 actual 9354448 (in thread 'Crawl_1017 launchthread')
> 2014-08-07T16:50:54.262Z INFO Job launched
> 2014-08-07T16:50:51.818Z INFO Job instantiated
>
>
> Thanks,
> Markus
